Whatsapp: WhatsApp's original name was WhatsApp Inc.  WhatsApp co-founder Jan Koum once worked as a security guard at a supermarket.  WhatsApp uses end-to-end encryption by default, meaning even WhatsApp itself cannot read your messages.
WhatsApp's status updates were initially only available for 24 hours before disappearing.
The app's iconic green color was chosen to represent growth and freshness.
WhatsApp briefly allowed users to send messages to themselves.
earth: Earth's rotation is gradually slowing down.
There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way galaxy.
A single day on Earth is slowly getting longer.
The Earth's core is as hot as the surface of the sun.
Earth is the only planet known to support life.
Around 70% of the Earth's surface is covered by water.
Earth's magnetic field flips polarity irregularly, with the north and south magnetic poles switching places.
The deepest point on Earth, the Challenger Deep in the Mariana Trench, is so deep that if Mount Everest were placed there, its peak would still be over a mile underwater.
Earth's atmosphere is constantly losing hydrogen atoms to space.
The Sun: The Sun rotates faster at its equator than at its poles.
The Sun's surface temperature is around 5,500 degrees Celsius, but its core reaches a scorching 15 million degrees Celsius.
The Sun loses about a billion kilograms of mass every second through solar wind.
Sunspots, appearing darker, are actually cooler regions on the Sun's surface due to intense magnetic activity.
Helium was first discovered in the Sun's spectrum before it was found on Earth.
The Sun's magnetic field reverses polarity approximately every 11 years, marking the peak of the solar cycle.
The Sun makes up about 99.86% of the total mass of the entire Solar System.
Sound waves travel through the Sun at speeds exceeding 350 kilometers per second.
The Sun's energy is produced through nuclear fusion, converting hydrogen into helium and releasing vast amounts of energy.
The Sun's magnetic field lines can sometimes reconnect explosively, releasing energy in the form of solar flares.
Tiny particles called neutrinos, created in the Sun's core, constantly pass through the Earth.
Github: GitHub's logo is a stylized version of a giant panda, a nod to the Git version control system's mascot.
GitHub uses a custom-built, highly optimized database system for its massive code repository, not a standard relational database like MySQL or PostgreSQL.
GitHub's Copilot, an AI-powered code completion tool, was initially trained on a massive dataset of public GitHub repositories.
GitHub: GitHub's logo, the Octocat, has been redesigned multiple times, reflecting the platform's evolution.
GitHub Pages allows users to host static websites directly from their repositories for free.
GitHub Copilot, an AI pair programmer, can suggest code completions and entire functions in real-time.
